Overview
Welcome to FES/FOR 505, Advanced R Topics. This is an informal class for students wanting to get a little extra practice in R. We will work together through material in real time.
The class will meet once per week for 2 hours over 10 weeks. Each class will be a mix of instruction on the topic, discussion, and active work in R. Materials (slides, links, R scripts) will be listed on the Materials page throughout the quarter, so check back each week.
The plan so far:
Week 01: Introduction to Git/GitHub
Week 02: Build a personal website with distill and postcards
Week 03: Deploy website using GitHub Pages
Week 04: Explore gt for making tables
Week 05: More advanced gt examples
Week 06: Learn to write functions in R
Week 07: Animated graphics (with gganimate)
Week 08: Interactive graphics (?)
Week 09: More Git: forking and pull requests
Week 10: Other topics of interest
Software
We will be working in R via RStudio. Make sure you have up-to-date versions of both of these. Current versions:R 4.0.4RStudio 1.4
Packages
I’ll be adding to the package list throughout the term as we hammer out exactly what topics will be covered. You’ll want to install these on your computer so you’re ready to go.

Week 1: Introducing Git and GitHub
Goals
Create version-controlled directory for your future website!
But also:
Create GitHub account
Install Git
Introduce yourself to Git
Create first repository and link to it in R/RStudio
Resources
We will rely heavily on Happy Git and GitHub with R, in particular chapters 4, 6, 7, 11, and 12
Materials for class
Week 01 slides
Week 2: Create a distill website
Goals
Create a personal website to showcase your work
Create distill website in version-controlled directory
Edit _site.yml to control website design
Edit index.Rmd to add personal details with postcard
Change website appearance with a basic theme change
Resources
The distill website has great material for getting started: https://rstudio.github.io/distill/
Tom Mock has a nice intro to distill here
Alison Hill’s post on postcards here
The distillery showcase is great for inspiration and ideas on website design

Week 3: More on distill articles and deploy website
Goals
Ultimately we will deploy our websites via GitHub Pages
But first:
Add more distill articles to the website
Create citation entry
Add .bib file for references
Practice with footnotes, asides, and appendices
Add drop down menus and links within website pages
Resources
The distill website has articles on distill basics as well as citations
GitHub docs has an overview of publishing via GitHub Pages here
